metadata.title: CVE-2021-47237 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:hamradio: fix memory leak in mkiss_close My local syzbot instance hitmemory leak in mkiss_open()[1]. The problem was in missing free_netdev() inmkiss_close(). In mkiss_open() netdevice is allocated and then registered,but in mkiss_close() netdevice was only unregistered, but not freed. criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1117.123').
linux-azure package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1123.136~14.04.1').
